channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How President Trump has challenged a constitutional foundation
item.description: In his first year back in the White House, President Trump has presided over a sweeping expansion of executive power while eroding democratic norms.

item.title: Vietnam leader To Lam consolidates power as country targets 10% growth
item.description: Lam, 68, pledged to accelerate economic growth and was reappointed unanimously by the 180-member Central Committee at the conclusion of the National P...

item.title: Who's Board of Peace and who's bored of peace? The quiz knows — do you?
item.description: Plus: The Oscars, tool-using animals, Nobel drama and more.

item.title: Millions of Americans brace for winter storm. And, Zelenskyy's warning for Europe
item.description: Millions of Americans are bracing for a massive, life-threatening winter storm this weekend. And, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivers a stark messa...

item.title: How cuts to federal climate funds could threaten polar vortex research
item.description: Tens of millions of people are in the path of a major winter storm. Federal cuts threaten efforts to understand the causes of such weather.

item.title: School officials say 5-year-old was ICE "bait." DHS says he was abandoned.
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security disputes a Minnesota school district's claims that ICE agents used a 5-year-old boy as bait​ before taking the boy...

item.title: Minnesota gears up for anti-immigration enforcement protest Friday despite dangerous cold
item.description: A vast network of labor unions, progressive organizations and clergy has been asking Minnesotans to stay away from work, school and stores Friday to p...

item.title: Trump's claim Nato troops avoided Afghanistan front line sparks outrage in UK
item.description: The US president says Nato troops stayed "a little off the front lines" - despite 457 UK military deaths in the conflict.

item.title: 5 arrested in connection with shooting of judge, wife in Indiana
item.description: Five people have been arrested in connection with the Sunday shooting of a judge and his wife​ in Indiana, according to authorities.

item.title: What is Rule 523 in bankruptcy?
item.description: Rule 523 dictates the debts you can't erase through bankruptcy (and the list might surprise you).

item.title: Could trilateral talks yield a breakthrough in Ukraine-Russia war?
item.description: It's the first time representatives from Kyiv, Moscow and Washington have come together since the full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

item.title: High stakes but low expectations ahead of Ukraine talks with Russia and US
item.description: Donald Trump is pushing hard for a peace deal - but major issues between Russia and Ukraine are still unresolved, writes Sarah Rainsford.

item.title: Texas and Oklahoma brace for snow and ice as winter storm barrels toward eastern two-thirds of US
Could trilateral talks yield a breakthrough in Ukraine-Russia war?
item.description: It's the first time representatives from Kyiv, Moscow and Washington have come together since the full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

item.title: 'I saw people getting shot': Eyewitness tells of Iran protest crackdown
item.description: An Iranian who got out of the country describes scenes of chaos as security forces opened fire in her home town.

item.title: Immigrants often don’t open the door to ICE, but that may no longer stop officers
Invested in silver in 2025? Here's how much you can sell it for now.
item.description: A silver investment made at this point in 2025 could be worth significantly more now. But is it really worth selling?

item.title: Ryan Wedding, Olympic athlete turned alleged drug kingpin, is arrested, FBI says
item.description: Ryan Wedding, a 44-year-old Canadian national, was added to the FBI's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list last year.
